text: Robin Kornman (April 17, 1947 – July 31, 2007) is best known for his work as a Tibetan Buddhist scholar, as well as a founding member of the Nalanda Translation Committee. Up until his death, he had spent many years working on an English translation of the Tibetan (living) epic Gesar of Ling — it is his work on this translation that has gained him the most recognition. A longtime student of Chögyam Trungpa Rinpoche, Kornman had been co-director of Trungpa Rinpoche's first Shambhala Buddhist retreat center in North America, Karmê Chöling, when first established in 1970.Midal (2005) p. 478 Having earned his Ph.D. degree from Princeton University, Kornman was a professor of Comparative Literature at the University of Wisconsin - Milwaukee, published various translations and articles dealing with Buddhism, and acted as a meditation instructor and mentor to the Shambhala Buddhist Community. == References == ==Bibliography== * Kornman, Robin (2011) The Epic of Gesar of Ling: Gesar's Magical Birth, Early Years, and Coronation as King * Kornman, Robin (2007) Creating Enlightened Society: The Oral Instructions of Chögyam Trungpa, Rinpoche (Great Path Tapes & Books) * Midal, Fabrice ed.
